key_title: Key to the species of Centaurea

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Asteraceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Apical appendage of intermediate involucral bracts pectinate, lacerate or fimbriate, never spiny
Apical appendage of intermediate involucral bracts stiff and spiny
Capitula 25–60 mm diam.; florets yellow
Capitula to 25 mm diam.; florets purple, blue, pink or white, never yellow
Capitula 3–6 mm diam.; cauline leaves pinnatifid
Capitula more than 10 mm diam.; cauline leaves entire, toothed or pinnatisect
Lower involucral bracts without a clearly differentiated terminal appendage, margins toothed
Lower involucral bracts with a clearly differentiated terminal appendage constricted at attachment, margins of basal, non-modified part entire
Cauline leaves pinnatisect; pappus 4–5 mm long; probably not in Victoria, see note following genus description
Cauline leaves ± entire; pappus to 4 mm long
Basal and lower cauline leaves to 1.5 cm wide; pappus 2–4 mm long; annual or rarely biennial; probably not in Victoria, see note following genus description
Basal and lower cauline leaves greater than 3 cm wide; pappus 0.5–1 mm long; perrenial
Terminal appendage of lower involucral bracts undivided or lacerate
Terminal appendage of lower involucral bracts pectinate
Terminal appendage of involucral bracts entirely blackish; peripheral florets not expanded and raylike
Terminal appendage of involucral bracts brown to dark-brown, if black then confined to middle of appendage; peripheral florets expanded and raylike
Flowers purple; pappus absent
Flowers yellow; pappus present
Capitula ± concealed by an involucre-like cluster of foliar bracts
Capitula exposed, not concealed by an involucre-like cluster of foliar bracts
Apical appendage of intermediate involucral bracts consisting of a spine 6–9 mm long with 1–3 pairs of spinules along sides near base; cypsela longer than pappus
Apical appendage of intermediate involucral bracts consisting of a spine 10–25 mm long with 1 or 2 pairs of spinules at base only; cypsela shorter than pappus
